author: Forbes / EP
title: Las campa√±as comerciales de fin de a√±o e inicio de rebajas ofrecen 28.532 empleos, un 40% m√°s - Forbes Espa√±a
text:
Las campa√±as comerciales de fin de a√±o e inicio de rebajas han mejorado los resultados de 2022 tras registrar desde el ‚ÄòBlack Friday‚Äô un total de 28.532 puestos ofertados en sectores estrat√©gicos de la actividad comercial, lo que supone un 40% m√°s, seg√∫n el an√°lisis realizado por InfoJobs.
En concreto, m√°s de los 28.500 puestos ofertados desde la llegada del ‚ÄòBlack Friday‚Äô corresponden a estos sectores entre los que destacan compras, log√≠stica y almac√©n; atenci√≥n al cliente y venta al detalle, un aumento del 40% con respecto a 2022 y un 41% m√°s en comparaci√≥n con 2021. Adem√°s, supone un alza del 62% respecto a los datos de la misma campa√±a en periodo prepandemia, cuando se registraron 17.590 vacantes en 2019. As√≠, ocho de cada 10 puestos ofertados pertenecen a categor√≠as clave de la actividad comercial.
De esta forma, el sector de compras, log√≠stica y almac√©n es el que m√°s empleo ha generado durante el periodo analizado, ya que re√∫ne m√°s de 15.600 puestos de trabajo, seguida por atenci√≥n al cliente con m√°s de 8.700 vacantes, y venta al detalle, con casi 4.200.
Las vacantes registradas por la plataforma reflejan que un total de 22.948 empleos ofrec√≠an contrato de duraci√≥n determinada, es decir, un 64% de las vacantes, mientras que tan s√≥lo el 5% ten√≠an car√°cter indefinido (1.822 empleos).
La plataforma ha precisado que esto ocurre porque se trata de un periodo de contrataci√≥n muy concreto, para una campa√±a de pocos meses que se concentra a final de a√±o. Asimismo, la contrataci√≥n en campa√±a de rebajas depende en cierta medida de las previsiones y de c√≥mo evolucionen las ventas de la misma, es decir, a mayores ventas, mayor necesidad de contrataci√≥n.
Respecto a las vacantes registradas por InfoJobs para la campa√±a de rebajas, Madrid (con 12.500 vacantes), Castilla-La Mancha (con 5.600) y Catalu√±a (con 4.600) consiguen reunir actualmente el 64% de las vacantes totales contabilizadas a nivel nacional. A estas les sigue Galicia, que recoge m√°s de 3.100 puestos de trabajo ofertados.
Para leer m√°s

author: @UnioneSarda
title: Macomer, la ex Colonia diventa centro operativo contro gli incendi
text:
Parte un‚Äôimportante e singolare iniziativa per tutelare i boschi di una vasta zona tra il monte di Sant'Antonio e il Montiferro .
La ex colonia Eca , nella zona di Su Cantareddu, nel monte di Sant'Antonio, per tre mesi , a partire da domenica, diventa centro operativo per la prevenzione degli incendi e tutela dei boschi dell'intero territorio . Questo grazie ad un accordo stipulato fra l'associazione nazionale Alpini e il Comune di Macomer, col benestare della Regione.
Una sorta di gemellaggio che ha come scopo quello di mettere in campo il meglio del volontariato nella lotta contro incendi . La ex colonia Eca, per anni in disuso e abbandonata al degrado, ma in una posizione strategicamente baricentrica per poter rispondere in maniera efficace alle esigenze di controllo di una vasta area della Sardegna centrale, √® stata rimessa a posto per accogliere il gruppo dei volontari dell'Ana.
¬´La scelta di aderire al progetto che ci √® stato proposto dall'Ana - dice l'assessore all'ambiente, Toto Listo - √® stata immediata e convinta, per favorire l'attivit√† del volontariato nella tutela dei boschi¬ª.
L'insediamento degli alpini dell'Ana nella ex colonia Eca avverr√† domenica con una cerimonia, assieme alle autorit√† locali.
¬© Riproduzione riservata

author: Maggie Macintosh, Local Journalism Initiative Reporter Winnipeg Free Press
title: Rocky start for workplace probe at teachers union
text: Staff members at the Manitoba Teachers‚Äô Society met the official launch of a third-party probe into the union‚Äôs embattled headquarters with outrage, tears and widespread skepticism this week. Richter Consulting has been hired to investigate workplace culture, harassment and morale issues raised by employees who are in charge of servicing more than 16,600 public school teachers. Glen Anderson, interim executive director, relayed the ‚Äúworkplace assessment‚Äù schedule, starting with a team of Montreal consultants who conducted in-person interviews between Sept. 10-12, during the first staff-wide meeting of the school year. Union leaders selected Richter to assess culture and climate on the Portage Avenue campus and review the organization‚Äôs structure after engaging with six consultants, Anderson said. The 9 a.m. meeting evolved into a two-hour event of emotional speeches and tense exchanges between employees and both their interim boss ‚Äî the third individual to assume the union‚Äôs top non-partisan post in 10 months ‚Äî and consultant Heidi Lange. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been year after year after year of failed attempts to fix and so, I just feel completely hopeless. I have no hope and today has not helped at all,‚Äù one staffer said during the hybrid meeting, a recording of which was obtained by the Free Press. Another employee described the workforce, which she said is grappling with workload and cultural issues, as being in a collective state of mourning for an organization that has repeatedly proven to be dysfunctional. The 2021-22 handling of an equity audit, the 2023 pause of a strategic plan when workplace grievances were aired during consultations, and the brief tenure of MTS‚Äô first human resources director were cited as reasons staff are skeptical of the latest initiative. This time last year, after receiving the damning results of a workplace survey conducted by Teamsters Local Union 979, MTS created an HR position to go beyond payroll duties and approach personnel and workplace issues from a broader perspective. Teamsters Canada represents roughly 80 people whose roles range from advocating for teachers who have classroom-related concerns to planning professional development sessions. Union spokesman Christopher Monette said Local 979 has filed 12 grievances in connection to what it calls ‚Äúthe reigning toxic work environment‚Äù in one of the largest public-sector unions in Manitoba. ‚Äú(Richter‚Äôs) involvement has so far only worsened matters,‚Äù Monette wrote in an email Thursday. He noted a consultant referred to some employees as ‚Äúcoloureds‚Äù in the context of a discussion on race when speaking to staff about the firm‚Äôs proposal last month. ‚ÄúOur members are understandably frustrated and angry. The society has a legal obligation to provide a harassment-free workplace, and they are failing to meet that standard,‚Äù Monette added. On Tuesday, both Anderson and Lange apologized to employees for the latter‚Äôs comments on Aug. 20 and reaffirmed the partnership between MTS and Richter. ‚ÄúFor me, it was lost in translation‚Ä¶ My intention was not to hurt anybody or offend anybody. You have to know that for me, diversity, inclusion, equity are really important and values that I cherish a lot,‚Äù the francophone consultant said. Multiple employees expressed concern about the safety of a minority of MTS staff who identify as Indigenous, Black and people of colour in the review process and ensure their anonymity in a final report. Others criticized the organization‚Äôs elected board for not acting sooner to address employees‚Äô concerns. There were several points during which the room erupted in applause in response to staff who vocalized frustrations. Anderson was accused of trying to silence employees around 10 a.m. when he suggested the group disperse to allow Richter‚Äôs team to begin interviewing. In a mass email to staff Wednesday, the interim leader ‚Äî who is stern and, at times, audibly irritated in a recording ‚Äî said managers felt it was important to acknowledge the prior day‚Äôs events were ‚Äúdifficult‚Äù for everyone involved. ‚ÄúAs the meeting unfolded and emotions became more heightened, some staff conducted themselves in a disrespectful manner such as raising voices, interrupting, criticizing, and insulting co-workers,‚Äù Anderson wrote in the memo. Senior leaders will follow up to address such behaviour and ensure staff understand they are responsible for treating others with respect, ‚Äúeven when frustrated or upset,‚Äù he said. Teamsters is urging managers to listen, Monette said, adding: ‚ÄúWe urge the society to stop viewing their staff as adversaries.‚Äù Lange, the main consultant, told the Free Press that employees‚Äô distraught reactions on Tuesday demonstrated the importance of her consulting firm‚Äôs exercise. The project is ultimately a demonstration of the employer‚Äôs will to try to find a solution, she said. MTS president Nathan Martindale was not made available for an interview. Martindale and Cynthia Taylor, vice-president of the elected board responsible for governing the union, issued a joint statement on their commitment to working with Anderson to address staff concerns and needs. Richter does not have a hard deadline for its work. The consulting team is expected to submit a final report with recommendations to Martindale, Taylor and other members of the provincial executive.

author: 9News
title: Ground News - Single parents turn to house sharing amid surging cost of living
text: When single mum-of-two Michelle separated from her partner, she knew she wanted to keep her own home on Sydney's northern beaches.With a newborn baby and a five-year-old, she also knew she didn't want to have to work crazy hours away from her children to be able to afford to do so."I didn't want to be leaving for work at 6.30-7 o'clock in the morning and coming home at 6.30 or 7 o'clock at night," she said."That would mean long days for the kids‚Ä¶ Summary by 9News 1 Articles 1 Articles All Left Center Right [] 9News When single mum-of-two Michelle separated from her partner, she knew she wanted to keep her own home on Sydney's northern beaches.With a newborn baby and a five-year-old, she also knew she didn't want to have to work crazy hours away from her children to be able to afford to do so."I didn't want to be leaving for work at 6.30-7 o'clock in the morning and coming home at 6.30 or 7 o'clock at night," she said."That would mean long days for the kids‚Ä¶ 4 hours ago¬∑AustraliaRead Full Article Think freely.Subscribe and get full access to Ground NewsSubscriptions start at $9.99/year [Subscribe](/subscribe) Not enough coverage to generate an Article Assistant. author: DPA
title: Tunneleinsturz in Los Angeles: 31 Arbeiter gerettet
text:
Tunneleinsturz in Los Angeles: 31 Arbeiter gerettet
Die Sorge ist zun√§chst gross, als erste Meldungen √ºber einen Tunneleinsturz in Kalifornien bekannt wurden. Doch eine Katastrophe ist ausgeblieben.
Aufatmen in Kalifornien: Nach dem Einsturz eines Tunnels im Grossraum der US-Metropole Los Angeles hat die Feuerwehr alle Eingeschlossenen bergen k√∂nnen. 31 Menschen, wohl alle Tunnelarbeiter, seien am Mittwochabend (Ortszeit) lebend und ohne sichtbare Verletzungen gerettet worden, teilte die Feuerwehr mit. Der Ungl√ºcksort befindet etwa 30 Kilometer s√ºdlich des Zentrums von Los Angeles.
Ersten Berichten der Feuerwehr zufolge gelang es einigen Arbeitern nach dem Einsturz, √ºber einen Berg loser Erde zu klettern. Auf der anderen Seite trafen sie demnach auf Kollegen. Anschliessend seien die Eingeschlossenen mit einem Tunneltransportmittel zum Ausgang gebracht worden. Sanit√§ter versorgten daraufhin die Geretteten und untersuchten sie genauer, hiess es.
Ein grosser Rettungseinsatz
Mehr als 100 Einsatzkr√§fte waren nach Angaben der Feuerwehr zum Ungl√ºcksort geeilt, darunter spezialisierte Rettungsteams. Der Einsturz passierte demnach mehr als acht Kilometer vom einzigen Tunneleingang entfernt. Es handele sich um einen im Bau befindlichen Tunnel f√ºr die kommunale Abwasserentsorgung, hiess es weiter. Die Ermittlungen zur Ursache des Einsturzes dauern an.
Etwa eine Stunde waren die Arbeiter in dem Tunnel eingeschlossen, meldete CBS News. Der Tunnel sei insgesamt mehr als 11 Kilometer lang und etwas mehr als f√ºnf Meter breit, schrieb der US-Sender unter Berufung auf den Betreiber.

author: John Aizlewood
title: Bobby De Cordova-Reid provides touch of class as Fulham pass Rotherham test
text:
The Telegraph Bobby De Cordova-Reid provides touch of class as Fulham pass Rotherham test Read full article John Aizlewood 6 January 2024 at 1:00 am ¬∑ 2-min read Bobby Decordova-Reid's well-taken strike was the difference betwene the two sides - Getty Images/Henry Nicholls
With Brentford and Wolverhampton drawing in the early kick-off and Crystal Palace and Everton failing to score on Thursday, Fulham became the first team to progress to the fourth round of the FA Cup, albeit with a perfunctory victory over Rotherham United.
‚ÄúOur obligation was to control the game,‚Äù said Marco Silva, the Fulham head coach. ‚ÄúWe weren‚Äôt at out best but job done, a professional performance.‚Äù
On an evening distinctly short of FA Cup magic, a partially closed ground hosted a near-silent crowd as one team who, slenderness of their winning margin notwithstanding, never needed to break sweat, played host to eager but woefully limited visitors.
‚ÄúI‚Äôll take the positives,‚Äù contended Leam Richardson, the Rotherham head coach. ‚ÄúWe nullified them in many areas.‚Äù
Bottom of the Championship and without an away victory since November 2022, Rotherham seemed to be ideal visitors for a team with an understandable eye on Wednesday‚Äôs Carabao Cupo semi-final. So it would prove, but Silva still took no chances: other than Afcon-bound Alex Iwobi , all the outfield players who began against Arsenal on Sunday were starters or substitutes.
Made them pay üí™
Some hit from @bobbyreid93 for @FulhamFC üí• #EmiratesFACup pic.twitter.com/fW6WmEkU5x
‚Äî Emirates FA Cup (@EmiratesFACup) January 5, 2024
Fulham won it when Aston Villa loanee Sebastian Revan dallied in his own area. Harry Wilson picked his pocket and the ball spun to Bobby De Cordova-Reid, who expertly curled his second goal in a week beyond Viktor Johansson from the edge of the area.
‚ÄúThat‚Äôs why Seb‚Äôs on loan,‚Äù sighed Richardson.
It should have been more but Fulham were both betrayed by their prodigal finishing and thwarted by Rotherham‚Äôs defensive doggedness. Andreas Pereira hit the post. Revan gained some redemption by throwing himself at Rodrigo Muniz ‚Äôs goalbound follow-up; Sean Morrison brilliantly blocked another Muniz drive after Johansson spilled a cross and Johansson himself brilliantly tipped over Tosin Adarabioyo ‚Äôs thunderous header.
The longer the game progressed without a Fulham second the more Rotherham might have fancied their chances, but an actual chance never came. The did have more possession as the end drew nigh and Oliver Rathbone injected some much-needed thrust, but the evening started and finished without their erstwhile loanee Marek Rodak needing to make a save.

Ange Postecoglou dismisses speculation over Eric Dier absence 4. ESPN calls Aaron Rodgers' Jimmy Kimmel comments 'dumb and factually inaccurate,' will continue his appearances 5. Francis Ngannou vs. Anthony Joshua set for 10-round boxing fight in Saudi Arabia

author: straitstimes.com
title: France expels 'radical' Tunisian imam - interior minister | The Straits Times
text:
PARIS - France has expelled a Tunisian Muslim cleric for "radicalism" and "unacceptable remarks", Interior Minister Gerald Darmanin said in a statement on Twitter.
"The radical Imam Mahjoub Mahjoubi has just been expelled from the national territory, less than 12 hours after his arrest. We will not let people get away with anything," Darmanin said in a statement on X.
In an earlier statement, Darmanin said he had given instructions to issue a ministerial deportation order against "this radical 'imam' with unacceptable remarks". "Firmness is the rule," he added.
In a post that went viral on social media and was widely reported in French media, the imam referred to "the three-coloured flag" as "satanic".
Mahjoubi, who preached in the Ettaouba mosque of Bagnols-sur-Ceze, southern France, has denied any wrongdoing. He told French media that his comments had been taken out of context and that he had not meant to disrespect the French flag. The French flag has three colours: blue, white and red.
His lawyer told French media he will appeal the expulsion procedure.
French media published excerpts of the expulsion order, which stated that Mahjoubi had "conveyed a literal, backward, intolerant, and violent conception of Islam, likely to encourage behaviors contrary to the values of the Republic, discrimination against women, identity retreat, tensions with the Jewish community, and jihadist radicalization'."
BFM reported that Mahjoubi was being held in administrative detention in the Paris region.
Darmanin did not specify where the imam had been held nor when, how and where to he was expelled.
Franceinfo reported that Mahjoubi was on a plane headed to Tunis on Thursday evening.
Darmanin said that the French government's new immigration law, voted earlier this year, had allowed for the quick expulsion of the imam.
With the far-right RN party leading in polls for European elections in June, President Emmanuel Macron is under pressure to be tough on immigration and identity issues. REUTERS
Join ST's Telegram channel and get the latest breaking news delivered to you.

author: Antoni Verd
title: Aporte intelectual escaso
text: S√°nchez y su gobierno tienen una fijaci√≥n con la oposici√≥n. Lo que hace, seg√∫n escuch√© de la vicepresidenta Montero en sede parlamentaria, es estorbar. Si hubiera seguido hablando tal vez hubiera llegado a decir que consecuentemente deb√≠a ser cancelada... Se gobernar√≠a mejor sin estorbos. Es la consecuencia l√≥gica. Est√° claro que la solvencia intelectual de esta se√±ora dista mucho de lo que se puede esperar de un miembro de cualquier gobierno del mundo. L√©ase bien la perla que hace unos d√≠as solt√≥: ¬´Cobrar el salario m√≠nimo, o sea 1.323 ‚Ç¨ mensuales si se prorratea en 12 pagas anuales, es ser clase media¬ª ¬øSe dio cuenta de lo que dijo? Seguro que no. Pero da igual que igual da. Ser ministro, incluso presidente del gobierno no es lo que era. El aporte intelectual es escaso, cuando se ha concluido con la lista de improperios: ¬´extrema derecha¬ª, ¬´derecha extrema¬ª, ¬´ultra derecha¬ª, ¬´fachas¬ª, ¬´fachosfera¬ª, ¬´barro¬ª, ¬´ruido¬ª, ¬´embarrar¬ª, etc. Y, despu√©s de las elecciones europeas del 9-J, m√°s todav√≠a. Pues son ahora tres los puntos destinatarios de las invectivas alternativas de los argumentos: PP, Vox y Alvise P√©rez. No plante√°ndose, con Her√°clito de √âfeso, el devenir como la s√≠ntesis de polaridades. Ni compartir que no se puede apreciar el bien sin el mal, la salud sin la enfermedad ni el gobierno sin la oposici√≥n; pues todo est√° referido a lo que se le opone. Como la derecha a la izquierda y viceversa. Evidentemente, el gobierno que padecemos no tiene claro que en democracia la leal confrontaci√≥n de la oposici√≥n es necesaria. En las cortes franquistas, evidentemente no hab√≠a confrontaci√≥n. Como tampoco la hab√≠a en las dumas sovi√©ticas. Aporte intelectual escaso Tambi√©n en Opini√≥n [Casas de 90 metros por poco m√°s de 25.000 euros: estos son los municipios donde puedes comprarlas](/noticias/nacional/2024/07/04/2197293/vivienda-espana-estos-son-municipios-mas-baratos.html) [Multa de 2.650 euros y posible retirada de custodia al due√±o de los perros encerrados en malas condiciones en Palma](/sucesos/ultimas/2024/07/04/2197559/mas-2500-euros-multas-posible-retirada-custodia-dueno-perros-encerrados-malas-condiciones-palma.html) [Pelea multitudinaria entre personas de etnia gitana y menores africanos en Palma](/sucesos/ultimas/2024/07/05/2197887/pelea-multitudinaria-entre-personas-etnia-gitana-menores-africanos-palma.html) [Una mujer descubre que su inquilino abusaba de su hija de 9 a√±os gracias a una c√°mara oculta](/sucesos/ultimas/2024/07/05/2197265/agresion-sexual-mallorca-detenido-hombre-manacor-por-agresion-sexual-hija-anos-casera.html) [Tiburones: Estas son las playas baleares con m√°s posibilidad de avistamientos](/noticias/local/2024/07/05/2196915/tiburones-estas-son-playas-baleares-mas-posibilidad-avistamientos.html) 4 comentarios Resumiendo la derecha es "super guay" y la izquierda pues lo de siempre malo, malo, malo. Pues como dijo aquel "bueno, pues vale, pues adi√≥s". Sr Verd voste com sempre predicant!!! Valdr√≠a mes que se preocupas des seus i de lo que fan. De moment 3 anyets mes menjant morena. Voste deu fer flamada!!! Avui es un dia per sentir-se ORGULLOSO!!! Blanquear la extrema derecha, tiene su precio. Ortega decia que ‚Äúla claridad es la cortesia del filosofo‚Äù En este caso se puede decir: la lucidez es la cortesia del articulista‚Ä¶.
